chemoreception.notes: Trematodes likely rely on chemoreception to locate hosts and navigate their environment. This is inferred due to the parasitic lifestyle common in this group and other trematodes.

mechanoreception.notes: Likely used to detect changes in the host environment and physical contact. This is inferred due to the parasitic lifestyle common in this group and other trematodes.

photoreception.notes: The presence or absence of photoreception in Aspidogastridae is currently unknown.
